info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 19 at 5:08PM MDT until May 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Southwestern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 700 PM MDT.
* At 505 PM MDT, a plume of blowing dust extended from south of Deming, across southern Dona Ana County, and into El Paso. Satellite imagery indicates denser dust is about to move into West El Paso and Santa Teresa, and visibility will likely drop to around 1 mile as it spreads east.
HAZARD...Visibility as low as one mile. Wind gusts to 45 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 39. Portions of New Mexico Highway 9 west of Santa Teresa will also be impacted.
Locations impacted include... El Paso, Santa Teresa, Sunland Park, Horizon City, Anthony, Hueco Tanks, Canutillo, Vinton, and Westway.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Luna, NM; El Paso, TX
